action.action-desc: Mr. Filner introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

Additional sponsors: Mr. Michaud, Mr. Chandler, Mr. Gordon of Tennessee, Mr. Lincoln Diaz-Balart of Florida, Mr. Walz, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, Mr. Boswell, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Young of Florida, Mr. Braley of Iowa, Mr. Moran of Kansas, Mr. Boucher, Mr. Doggett, Ms. Herseth Sandlin, Mr. Peterson, Mr. Smith of Washington, Mr. Courtney, Ms. Berkley, Mr. Latham, Mr. Terry, Mr. Rooney, Ms. Titus, Mr. Heinrich, Ms. Linda T. Sánchez of California, Mr. Himes, Mr. Rodriguez, Mrs. Halvorson, Mr. Carnahan, Mr. Oberstar, Mr. Israel, Mr. Hastings of Florida, Ms. Corrine Brown of Florida, Mr. Schock, Mr. Arcuri, Mr. Kirk, Mr. Tim Murphy of Pennsylvania, and Mr. Roskam
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

form.official-title: To amend the Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Programs Enhancement Act of 2001 and title 38, United States Code, to require the provision of chiropractic care and services to veterans at all Department of Veterans Affairs medical centers and to expand access to such care and services.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Chiropractic Care Available to All Veterans Act.

section.header: Program for provision of chiropractic care and services to veterans
section.text: Section 204(c) of the Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Programs Enhancement Act of 2001 (38 U.S.C. 1710 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (1) before The program; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The program shall be carried out at not fewer than 75 medical centers by not later than December 31, 2010, and at all medical centers by not later than December 31, 2012.

section.header: Expanded chiropractor services available to veterans

subsection.text: Paragraph (6) of section 1701 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
Paragraph (8) of such section is amended by inserting chiropractic, after counseling,.
Paragraph (9) of such section is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after subparagraph (E) the following new subparagraph (F):

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Chiropractic Care Available to All Veterans Act.

section.header: Program for provision of chiropractic care and services to veterans
section.text: Section 204(c) of the Department of Veterans Affairs Health Care Programs Enhancement Act of 2001 (38 U.S.C. 1710 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting (1) before The program; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The program shall be carried out at not fewer than 75 medical centers by not later than December 31, 2011, and at all medical centers by not later than December 31, 2013.

section.header: Expanded chiropractor services available to veterans

subsection.text: Paragraph (6) of section 1701 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:
Paragraph (8) of such section is amended by inserting chiropractic, after counseling,.
Paragraph (9) of such section is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting after subparagraph (E) the following new subparagraph (F):

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
